review: So special diet friendly I sighed in relief. And tasty!

Normally I don't feel the need to review chain restaurants, unless I have an outstanding or piss poor experience.  Our visit here a few weeks ago consisted of excellent food and some of the best service I've ever been treated to! I came here with a group of ~10 people (family).  We sat in the back, where we were more easily accommodated.  Most of the orders were typical fare for RR - burgers and sandwiches.  I think we all ordered (soft) drinks, tea, etc. Even though the food was good, the highlight of the evening was the service.  Our waitress (I wish I could remember your name!) was OUTSTANDING!  Her cheerful attitude was slightly contagious, we were never left waiting for drink/fry refills, and she had a sense of urgency when moving through the dining room, which a lot of typical waiters/waitresses lack (not that I don't blame them). I wish I could request to be in your section for our next visit!

My first time to red robin ! Yes, I admit it :) The service Basic service that you will get in all similar type of restaurant. Server greet you at the door. Then bring you to the table. And server will come and take your menu. Come once in a while to check if everything is OK. No complaint here. As expected :) The food I tried fish and chip with the bottomless steak cut potatoes. Surprisingly, the fish and chips were good. Crispy outside The fish were fresh and not soggy. I like it. The potatoes were OK. Try to put red robins special spice. It made it a lot better. However, my cousin's sweet potato fries were a lot better. It was also bottomless and you only have to pay .79 cent more The location They are located in a plaza where you can find other restaurant or store surrounding it. Parking were easy. They have parking lot. Strategically located in the middle of the town the atmosphere If you come in the afternoon or early evening, that might be better. We arrived there at night, and our table was dark. Even though we had the lights on the top of our table but they covered it to make it looks artsy. With lots of red color inside, eating wont be that relax. A bit pressure comes with it :) Just my opinion. Would I come back again ? probably not unless I am on road trip :)

We were there for a weekend dinner.  The bottomless strawberry lemonade was nice (though I admit it is getting old somehow). This time, a couple of things keep me in mystery. 1. OK. We were sitting at a table, the next table was empty, and the table next to it was occupied with a  couple of teenage girls.  In a while, a middle-aged couple was directed to the table and sat there. And, a waitress (table-sitting-person? whatever) came and said "Do you guys want to move? I know you wouldn't want to sit next to.." and the couple moved away to another table. At this point, I looked around to see what was wrong with the table. Did it have a pole next to it? No. Did it have an alligator next to it? No. ... Then a while later, another group (a mom and an elementary-school-aged daughter) was directed to the table. (unfortunately, I don't know if it was the same person who got the couple away or not). and noone came to ask if they wanted to move. 2. I ordered a burger on the menu that said it came with bottomless fries. I ate up the fries but the waitress never offered for the refill. She asked the  mom next to me if she wanted any, though. Probably neither is a big deal, but, combining with other experiences I'd had at Red Robins, these don't leave me with good impression.

I'm somewhat of a regular at this Red Robin for lunch because it is near my work, they have good food, and the service is always great. Their employees are very friendly and provide great service. The honey mustard dipping sauce keeps me coming in as often as I do though. :)

Went in for my bday burger a few days ago. Spaced out registering my card, so there it was on my bill. Server, Michelle (freakin awesome already) talked to the  Mgr. on duty, code name, Mama J. She saw that the month was coming to an end, and took care of the bill for me. Two incredibly friendly, and customer service oriented young ladies (coming from someone w/25+ yrs customer svc!). Thanks again, ladies!!

I eat here all the time with my wife. Staff members are all friendly and the food is always good. Nothing like a monster sized burger and 22 oz. beer!! Only thing I don't like is all the kids running around everywhere, but it's a family restaurant so this type of environment is expected.

Because we shop at Trader Joe's..(right across the street) we have a tendency to lunch at this Red Robins.  This particular month is my Birthday Month...and I am a card carrying member (puffing out chest) of the Red's Rewards program...so you know what THAT MEANS?!?!  A free burger!!!   We made the smart choice to eat BEFORE shopping for food...uh huh...we've made that mistake before.  Anywhoo... my mom ordered the French Onion soup and a salad and I got my burger on.  The French Onion is no stranger to my mother....and she is of age where she "knows" how it always tastes, looks...feels...talks to her...(rolling eyes).. and this particular bowl said it all wrong.  But, being that she is of the generation that doesn't say anything (to the servers...not to me...noooooooo...she kept yammering on to me...the one who can't do anything about it)...and instead just eats the sub standard food item...   You feel the stress here?  Yeah... so she complained to me after the server walked away...I couldn't take it anymore, so I flagged our server down and explained the situation...so that I could be the "bad guy" instead of mom.  lol...   The server and Assistant manager sprung into action and immediately comped her meal...and mine was a birthday freebie...so we had a really inexpensive lunch.  Not to worry, we tipped on the full pre-comped amount...and more.  I've been a server.. I would NEVER cheap out on good service.  :) GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!  Food has always been predictable without disappointment... AND they support our troops! Two thumbs up!

After years of eating at Red Robin it has been disappointing to see the slow gradual decline of the quality of both the food and service.   One of the people in our party ordered some french onion soup.  What was served looked and tasted like cold, dark polluted sea water topped with silly puddy disguised as cheese.  Our complaint and request to have it removed both from our table and cheque was complied with.   Upon looking over at the food preparation area I noticed the slick gelled hair assistant manager giving one of his female subordinates a deep, sensual back and scalp massage.  Upon completion of his services, he quickly picked up our plates with his dandruff flake fingers and ushered them to our tables. Our cheeseburgers were all cold, not warm, cold and nasty like yesterdays leftover chinese food.  The burger quality seems to have declined to the level of Burger King, but without being made to order or hot. We would have complained about our cold food but judging by the crowd that was shuffling in, TJ Max must have just closed, and the restaurant was getting busy so we just wanted to get out of there.

I'd love to be able to give this 4 and 1/2 stars, but I digress. Out of the local Red Robins, this is my favorite. Service is generally fast, the employees are friendly, and if there are any problems they're fast at fixing them.  Recently, my friends and I have had an issue where when ordering her burger "no pink" it's come out with a good amount of pink in the middle. Each time, the waitress and manager has been quick to fix the situation, and that often includes comping her meal. (We always tip off the full value though.)  The only complaint I have at this location is the Manager? Assistant Manager? who generally has very greasy looking spiked hair. It looks unprofessional, and quite frankly as a rule of thumb would have me not coming back. (I haven't seen him the past few visits however.)  While the food is never exceptional, it's never been bad either. I don't come to Red Robin expecting the best food in the industry, but I am always happy when I leave.  I've taken to the freckled lemonade recently, and the waitresses I've had are always quick to refill it for me. (Often before I can tell them that I've had enough!)  I'll happily continue to come here when I need a fairly fast, decent lunch.

Red Robin -- fun place to meet friends, have a burger, share a joke and have a laugh.  Their food gets a solid "B" from me.  It's good.  I love their French Onion Soup and their Spinach and Artichoke dip.  This time I will say their dip was a little weird, too much spinach I think. The Customer Service is ALWAYS spot on -- and we tipped accordingly - which means we don't go by the 18-20% model.  If it's great service you get a great tip from us -- if the service sucks regardless of how amazing the food you aren't going to get a great tip - I don't care what the rules say. My water glass is never empty, they always says please and thank you, the food comes out hot and if its not right they fix it on the spot or they comp your meal. Can't go wrong there:)

When in Beaverton eat as a Beavertonian would.  Red Robin is like TGI Fridays but here is the kicker...unlimited fries!!!  I ate literally 3 servings of fries, 6 dishes of mayo and one thousand island dressing.  I was sneaky and ended up taking most of my burger back to the hotel for a late night snack. Weird waiters though, kind of goofy like office space.

Came here with my sister and some of her friends. We were served by Fatih who was extremely nice and kept up on our drinks and waters making sure we were well taken care of. The food was excellent as I always expect at a Red Robin. One of our friends didn't like the salad so much because he said it was drowning in dressing. We suggested that he return it and get a new one but he refused. I personally like a lot of dressing so... Anyway it was another perfect experience at a Red Robin.

There is always a little place in my heart for Red Robin. I have gone to this place since the years when I used to watch spongebob and loony tunes...well I still do that now anyways. The burgers they serve are delicious, their fried are cooked with perfection, and they have always provided great service to their customers.
Always fast and consistent, avoid the wait and go early on Fridays and Saturdays.

I've been to this Red Robin many times before. Our waitress was very courteous and prompt.  However, the food made me sick. This is would be the first time this happened me. They were fairly quick with bringing the food out, however the quality seems to have declined.

You know this place is good for what it is - inexpensive burgers and fries when you just want a burger and some fries...though I did have a sandwich. Families come here so if you are like me and afraid of children and the noise they bring...avoid this place like the damned plague! Within minutes we were surrounded and they all had birthdays so we got to suffer through all the staff constantly screaming out their birthday song again and again... Perhaps takeout next time...

I eat here twice a month or so.  My server is Jodye - she rock the place!  She always is friendly, sweet, and a real pro.  Her service is fas and efficient.  The food arrives muy pronto, and very tasty.  Then, Jodye is back to make sure everything is perfect. This is not five star restaurant, it's up-scale fast food, prepared and served well.  With Jodye as your server ... you'll never go wrong! See you soon, Jodye!

The 5 stars here are relative to all the Red Robin locations I've been to. This location is definitely among the best. The staff are friendly and quick, and the food is served at the right temperature. Here's a secret: Red Robin doesn't do happy hour at certain times of the day like other places...they just have a $3/5/7/9 appetizer menu all day long -- and you have to try the pretzel bites on the $5 menu. Plus, the Tavern Double burger (which is a simple but perfected cheeseburger) is a great deal.
I love to whiskey river chix sandwich...addicted... Sodas always seem too flat and iced tea too over-brewed. Is that a even a word?

My wife and I have been regulars at this location for a couple of years now. The food is always delicious and the staff is always courteous. Our regular servers already know what we want (royal red robin burger, yum). Though we venture out and try new places every now and then we always end up back here some how. It's perfect for every occasion, wither it's the wife and I out for dinner and a beer or a family lunch with out kids. I love it so much it influenced my decision to movie into the neighborhood near by.

okay I have some serious mixed reviews about this place ranging from oh gods... what the hell... to oh yea this is what I am talking about... so I shall spit the difference and give it a 3 star. Now when I get food to go... Is when I have horrible issues. I have ordered their patty melt more times than I would care to admit.... some of the times on the to go orders, it is over cooked as in almost burnt, sometimes I am missing the onions or the wrong cheese. When I eat in the restaurant it is good and wonderful and crispy, on the outside, soft and gooey (in all the good cheesy ways) on the inside.  I have ordered other things but really it is a chain with decent food. It is though..... a FAMILY restaurant. so please expect children and families. However there are limits.... regular noise okay.... letting your kids run around or scream... not okay. I am okay when the kids are behaved. The staff does their best, but are not allowed to tell the parents to rein in their awful children lol.  I will continue to come here it is just not one of my favs .....

I called and ordered to pick up from here. I placed an order for 2 burgers at 8 and got there about 7:55, and was told my order got lost and it was a "good thing I came so early" so they could start on it. I waited about 20 minutes for my food. Sitting down to eat at home about 10-15 minutes later, we find a small amount of fries for each  burger (which is funny because they have endless fries whenever I eat there!) which were very soggy. The lettuce on my whiskey bbq chicken burger also tasted disgusting, it was soggy and wilted, besides that the burger was good. I may go back again, but only to eat in and will ask for no lettuce if I get a burger!
Best location by far! Thy have great employees! Food comes to you super fast! GREAT manager, mark. He sealed the 5 star!
Very friendly staff. Quick and reliable. Crispy chicken sandwich my way with extra onions and pickles, and of course bottomless fries.  I love this place.

Well the food is great, it's Red Robin. :)  But the service is horribly slow. I need to flag someone down to get a refill on my water, and it's not like I'm drinking it really fast either. Also, I almost never get a bottomless fry refill without waiting forever, sometimes I get tired of waiting. And they don't even give you that much fries anymore. So just be warned, the service sucks here.

I left my first 10% tip here. ever. I am a server and always tip well even if there are mistakes, but this was just goofy. I got a salad and my boyfriend got a cod sandwich.   There were 7 fries (uhh seriously) with his meal so we ordered more. We had asked for certain sauces with our food, they weren't there. No big deal, but both the reasonable amount of fries and the sauce we had asked for came when we were almost completely done with our food. Sauce does not take 10 plus minutes. Please move with a sense of urgency! Then I heard our server say "let's get them more fries so they're not mad." No dude we just wanted a normal amount the first time. There were a ton of people working there, but everything took way too long and I would hate to see that place busy! Not coming back because the service is lacking terribly.

Used to love Red Robin's burgers, especially since they offer a lettuce-wrapped version, but the burger that I had today was terrible.  It was tasteless...asked if they switched to frozen patties and was told that they did not, but it sure tasted like it!  Boo! Won't be back.

This location is not my normal spot.  It's close to work, we came for a birthday.  It's like most red robins, which is a good thing.  Service was good.  They were awesome being able to accommodate a group of 15 with just a phone call a few hours earlier. Our food came out within a reasonable time.   I had a crispy chicken sandwich with the buzzalo sauce.  They dipped the whole thing, which was perfect.  Often when I ask for that I get a drizzle of sauce.  So nice job cooks! Everyone's order was correct, and they even have us separate checks with no hassles.  We were in and out for lunch in about an hour.  Not bad when it was everyone's typical lunch hour.  I can see why several co-workers come here or get take out from this location.  They do not disappoint.  All in all I would have no problem coming back for lunch or dinner.
Consistently decent burgers at reasonable prices. Service is always excellent as is the beverage selection. There are better options around, by red robin is always a safe bet.

Took my 82yo mother here for a birthday celebration. The waiter was wonderful but the place way under staffed. The air conditioning so cold mom could not take her coat off and held to her coffee tight. All the food was well over fried and the drink shy with alcohol. Used to love this place but it is worsening.

Horrible.. I cannot believe the level of service we received tonight 11/20/14. Unbelievable. The people who serve am/pm hot dogs did a better job at serving people then the people at red robin. From the serve who never came to the table to refill water to the manager who came to the table asked us if we needed anything and I asked for a couple baskets of fries. Never came. My burger came out pink as pink can be sent it back. It never made it back. The cooks forgot. I cannot believe this is acceptable behavior. I cannot believe people are allowed to treat people like this.

I decided to try Red Robin awhile back. Less than impressed. The prices were ridiculous and the burgers were not what I expected. This restaurant is blown up so much on TV so it lured me in. The only thing I liked was the fries. That was about it.

And then management,  and corporate all got in touch with me on the above review. They really went the extra mile to make sure I was happy. We've returned and dined there again,  and you know,  this time the service was great. The meal was good as always. Increasing rating to 3*s.

Upon entering this location of Red Robin on a busy Saturday night, we were immediately greeted by the blonde female hostess. She took our two-person's party's name, she also welcomed us to check out the bar seating situation. We decided to wait for regular seating. Our wait time wasn't terrible; about 12 minutes which isn't too bad for a Saturday night around 7pm! The male host seated us once our names were called. We were directed to sit in a two person booth in the far back of the restaurant next to two large tables with screaming babies.  Our waiter came shortly and took our drink orders. We received our drinks, but no water. Then I shortly realized (because Red Robin is notorious for getting the beverage on the outside of the glass, resulting in sticky hands) that we had no napkins, let alone silverware.  Our orders were taken, and I ordered a side of fries for my boyfriend and I to share.  As we dealt with the two screaming babies and loud men next to us, our experience was quickly turning into a negative one. Our food came about twenty minutes in, and my salad had no dressing. I had no fork to eat said salad. The guy (who was not our waiter) who delivered our food came back thankfully and I asked for both water and silverware. His response? "Oh yeah, good idea!"  My boyfriend's hamburger order had about ten French fries accompanying it; our actual basket of fries no where in sight.  Our waiter did not come by to refill our drinks, and when asked about the whereabouts of our fries he quickly said "I'll get them right now" as opposed to letting my boyfriend let him know to forget about it, since we were ready to get the heck out of dodge and away from the babies and craptastic service.  There was no rhyme or reason as to why we were seated so far away from every other party in booths and why we were shoved in a corner to deal with the screaming. I understand that children and babies cry or act out. I'm not asking for a child to be stoic and mute. The constant screaming just doesn't make dinner conversation that easy.  Pair that with bad service, I will not be coming back to this establishment.
I come here quite often and always receive good service and good food. They are always fast and courteous:)

There's this guy that works the bar (almost every time I'm there) he's amazing!!! He's fast, attentive, friendly and keeps his bar CLEAN! You're awesome!!! You sir, are reason I come continue to come to this location! Cheers.
Good cobb and good service. Dont normally do chains but this was the better choice in the area.  We both had the same and left happy

Their service is always slow but this time was WORST. I was arriving there first to meet my sister on her lunch break. An hour is enough right? Wrong! An hour to get our food! First off the host was in the middle of taking customers to their seats, which is fine. But when she came back she didn't acknowledge me. I was like ok there was a group in front of me, so i didnt care. But when she came back once again from seating customers ...STILL payed no attention to me. A couple that came in 2 mins after got greeted when she came back and was being escorted to their seats when the guy said " well I think she was here first" when the host finally said " oohh" I told them go ahead with a fake smile. The waitress took forever to come and take our orders. I say bout 20...25 mins. And when she did come we ordered and asked for boxes with them as well. The food took forever as we assumed so I asked for the check right when she was putting the food on the table. She said  sorry that they are super busy. Um I understand it's lunch time but it wasn't too bad in there and why don't they have enough staffs to cover the lunch rush? And no extra fries to accommodate? My sisters lunch was an hour. When we got our food we packed it right away and I say she got 3 big bites from her burger and a couple fries down and her lunch was up, so you do the math.  We still tip because we always feel bad. Not exactly the 15% but enough. Oh well! Hopefully next time will be at a different location if not it will be a while that we will go back and hopefully they will have better staff.

I'm sure there's nothing I can say about Red Robin that you don't already know. Everyone has been to Red Robin, and everyone generally knows what to expect. Pretty good food, pretty good sevice, pretty good drinks. This location in particular stands out to me, however. The cocktails here taste better-- stronger, even. They don't skimp on the buffalo sauce for my go-to meal, the Buzz Clucks, like so many other locations do. And the service here is super friendly. If you're gonna hit up a Red Robin, I would recommend this one over any other location in the area. Things are much more consistent here, and the great service is worth it to me.

I've been a regular at this location for 10 years and the last time I was here was the last time for me It started by having to wait 10-15 minutes for a table with a hungry toddler (it wasn't very busy and I've NEVER had to wait for a table even on a busy Saturday or Sunday ), I had the WORSE service I've EVER had here!! Pushy waitress that wouldn't listen, got strawberry lemonade with only 1 piece of strawberry,  my BF ordered a half chocolate and half vanilla milkshake and instead got 1 of each, had to wait 20 minutes for my sons chocolate milk, ordered clicks n fries and instead got cold clicks and hard fries, asked 3 people including a manager a total of 6 times for ranch and never got any so I finally just asked for my check which took 20 minutes to get and another 10 to get back so I could sign the receipt and leave I ended up asking the waitress for a box for my food and said I was going to eat it at home where my food will be hot and I have ranch  I didn't want to leave a tip because I was so irritated with the whole thing but since I used a credit card it automatically charged a 20% tip  IF I ever go back I will make sure I have cash so I'm not forced to have a tip charged to my card for shitty serviced again They shouldve kept the people that made this place awesome instead of getting rid of them and hiring rude clueless people

Thank you for the great experience! It's been many years since the last time I visited a Red Robin and was drawn back with a free birthday burger from the royalty club. I was on my way too work, forgot my lunch and figured I'd walk in and ask if I could take my free burger to go. Not only did I get my free burger but also got a great restaurant experience! I'm the type that still feels guilty for free things so I ordered an appetizer to go with my burger. They were out of the item I ordered (which they realized and informed me of right away not 20min later) but they gave me a free appetizer card for my next visit. The bartender was awesome, made actual conversion while not ignoring any other customer! Thank you Andrew for starting my 12hr work day on a great note!
Great service and food at this one and if they ever mess up an order they always make it right. Seems better than some of the other ones in the area.

If I could give this less than a star I would. Don't get me wrong, I love red robins but this location is the worst one by far. The last three times I have been here I have gotten terrible service. The common theme here is painfully slow service. Usually my boyfriend and I can finish our meals and are waiting for the check within 30-40 minutes. The other day it took over an hour and it wasn't even busy. The waiter checked on us twice that entire time and would always forget to bring us the basket of fries we asked for, which we finally got after the bill....I will never be going to this location again.

For those of you, like myself, who have been patronizing this Red Robin store for years, please stop!! The service has been nothing short of abysmal for years now, and they appear to simple be coasting on the "Red Robin" name. The menu fare is good, it has been for decades. The problem is simply with customer service, which has become nearly non existent. And now, post remodel, the have a new organization that separates parties with children from those who don't. I have literally watched two families walk out when this was explained to them. To the ownership/management group in charge of this location. Very poor work indeed!!!

For me personally, the Bbq chicken wrap was pretty dry. I also found the 1" long hard chip shavings that they roll into their wraps both dangerous to eat and attempt to swallow. Even when trying to moisten up by chewing I found that they are compressed so tightly, they seem they aren't teeth crushable. Please be careful swallowing them whole by accident.  I would suggest until Red Robin gets a different chip supplier that it is safer to order any wraps without the tortilla chips rolled inside. Pros: Service was great as always and we left a big 50% tip:)
It doesn't matter which Red Robin I go to, I always leave satisfied after receiving good service. This location is no exception.

I have been a regular for over 20 years and my service last night was awful! Our waiter took 10 minutes to come take our drink order. Once we finally ordered and got our food then he disappeared. We wanted refills on soda and couldn't find our server. After 20 minutes or so he came by but only refilled my friends drink and then took off before i could ask for mine. Another 5-10 minutes later he walks by and says do you want a refill? Worst service I've ever had at Beaverton!!!!

My son needed a quick meal dropped off at his school and requested Red Robin. I ordered a kids meal and asked for a bottle of water instead of soda.  I don't like that sugary beverages are included in the kids meal anyway and thought substituting a bottle of water (it's a to-go order, remember?!) would be a no brainier. First, the server needed to check with her manager (seriously) then she said they would be happy to sell me a bottle of water for $1.99. No consideration given for the soda we weren't getting.   Boo Red Robin. A bottle of water should be an option for these kids at no charge.

This is the go to dinner place for my boyfriend and I if we don't really want to try anything new or travel far. We always have a great experience, our service is always good, and the burgers are always on point. I always order the turkey burger- it's always nice and juicy! I give this place a two thumbs up!

First of all I loved this place. They had great quality control and the burgers were always great and the fries were perfect! I was a regular and probably spent up to $100 per month there. Then they remodeled the restaurant. This is the second visit after the remodel that my food was inedible. Burger was cold, fries fried to oblivion. I was so unhappy I just asked to pay for my drink. To add insult to injury I watched the manager 10 feet away write off my food and walk away unconcerned. That was the last time I ever set foot in a Red Robin!

Returned for another try. We sat in the bar area. The bartender was quick to give us our drinks. He was also quick to take our orders. He was really nice. I ordered the chicken and shrimp. My mom had the mushroom burger. The food took awhile to get to our table but the mushroom burger was a hit for my mom however, the chicken and shrimp not so much. There was 6 pieces of shrimp no bigger than the size of a quarter. 2 chicken strips that looks like it should of been a kids meal. 3 stars for the bartender Andrew being on point with customer care. But -2 stars for my kids meal serving size. I left still hungry

I recently moved to the SW Portland/Beaverton area and I was delighted to find a Red Robin near by - I've always had good experiences at the Washington Square location when I lived in Lake Oswego. Unfortunately, this location just doesn't live up to the service I have come to expect from Red Robin.  My first experience was inside the restaurant dinning. My significant other and I sat in the bar on a rather slow Sunday afternoon only to wait over 20 minutes to be acknowledged. No water, menu or even a hello - simply no acknowledgement for over 20 minutes. My girlfriend did everything she could to keep me from leaving. That was my first service experience at this location.  My second experience, although hesitate to return after my first, was their order-to-go service. I love this service because who wants to get out of their PJ's to enjoy a delicious Raging Cajun Chicken sandwich? Unless, of course, you order a Raging Cajun Chicken sandwich and are told this item is no longer on the menu and they'll only make if for you this one time...really? Again, allow me to reiterate I have ordered this item almost religiously at the Washington Square location and no one said a word or batted an eye; in fact, they were impressed I remembered such an amazing menu item that even the cook asked if I had worked at Red Robin's before (I haven't, I just happen to think the sandwich is amazing).  Service is everything in my personal opinion. For example: if I make reservation at a 5-star restaurant at 6 o'clock but I am not seated until 6:30, it doesn't matter how good the food is because the service just wasn't there. As consumers we don't just pay for the impeccable burgers and bottomless fries Red Robin has come to be known for, but we pay for the entire dining experience.   According to an American Express survey dated in 2011, 78% of consumers have bailed on a transaction or not made an intended purchase because of a poor service experience. In addition to that, it is 6-7 times more expensive to acquire a new customer than it is to keep a current one, according to the White House Office of Consumer Affairs.  It is not just about good customer service, it is about good business. There's an old saying: If it doesn't make money, it doesn't make sense.  I think it is safe to say that outstanding customer service makes money, so it makes sense to provide it.
If you don't mind complete strangers sitting less than 2 feet away from you, this place is for you. Expensive,  crowded, food was just ok. Go somewhere exciting instead.

This is an updated review following my previous review which was a very bad experience. Since then, the manager from that Red Robin location had contacted me and sent us a $30 gift card to try out Red Robin again for a better experience. Although I was hesitant at first I decided after a few weeks to try it out again. We did not return to the same location but went to the one in Hillsboro next to the Espalande Mall. Much better service. And I appreciated the manager reaching out to us and trying to make our experience better. Kudos to Red Robin for still caring about their customers. I understand that even waiters and waitresses have bad days, and I'm assuming we must have been there on a bad day for her. Regardless this was a much better experience and I appreciate the $30 gift card from management.

My 4-year old (who is petite and not a huge eater) was starving at the end of his "meal."  Red Robin has apparently chosen to pay for their remodel by serving portions that are less than half the size they used to be.  For example, they revamped the children's menu, and the LARGE kids twirly pasta was literally less than the first bowl (of two) you used to receive when you ordered kids pasta.  You used to get a free refill of the pasta, but now you can't, so you're literally getting LESS THAN HALF what they provided in the past.  They offer free refills on the "side dish" but it's not feasible to fill up on tiny little two-tablespoon cups of fruit. The entrée salads are also half the size.  My Avo-Cobb-O salad contained half the lettuce there used to be served on a small plate in an attempt to make it seem large; it only had about a quarter of an avocado total, no olives and no egg.  They claim there are no eggs because of an egg shortage, but other restaurants are able to provide them (and seriously, one egg for this dish isn't a huge expenditure as it might be if it were a 5 egg custard or something of that nature).  They apparently no longer carry olives at all.  All in all, the entrée salad was smaller than an appetizer, and I was starving at the end of dinner.  (I had to give the bread to my children because they were also starving). All in all, it's apparent that Red Robin has decided to cut back the food they serve in order to cut costs.  What used to be a fun place to take the family on a whim is now extremely overpriced, and someplace only to be visited if you want to spend good bit of money on a small quantity of food.  Oh, and did I mention that they "ran out" of balloons as we sat there?  It was between 6:30 and 7:00 p.m. on a Saturday night, and they didn't have balloons.  So, no balloons, no olives, no eggs, tiny portions....definitely two thumbs down.  (The only highlight was that for the first time in months, the service was speedy and attentive).  We will not be returning anytime soon.

Someone said they would contact me MONTHS ago. A manger none the less. And nothing?! No follow up call no email nothing. FUCK RED ROBIN. Your food sucks and so does your restaurant. They care yeah? If they can't even make a phone call how do they treat there food??

Me and my family have been coming here for over a decade and the reason why we drive out of our way is because of great customer service and it's due to Chin. So thank you Red Robin for hiring people like him!!!
The burgers are amazing! Service is questionable but the burgers and brew keep us coming back.

Let me start by saying our server was awesome. Kim was really nice and helpful. Last week they started this new ordering system using an iPad like system. She showed us how to use it and was overall a great server. The food was bad. We both wanted our burgers with a little pink, mine  was slightly overdone and fiance's was chared. He got the Southern Charm burger what has candied bacon. After taking one bite, he realized it was regular bacon. We sent it back (kim brought us more fries whole we waited) and the new bacon was candied and pretty good, but upon closer inspection, it was the SAME BURGER he had taken a bit out of, with new bacon and a new top bun, seemingly to hide that it wasn't an entirely new burger. Their new way of you initial serving of fries is barely a handful. Given the issue with the new burger, Kim said that she would get the manager on duty for us. He apologized, comped both burgers, have us a coupon for next time, and said he would look into what happened in the kitchen. He went above and beyond our expectations., and frankly we wouldn't be coming back if it weren't for him and Kim. Hopefully  there was just someone new on the kitchen and the issues will get sorted out.
If you haven't been to Red Robin, then the question I have for you is, "Where have you been?" Everyone has been there. If you decide to go, be sure to get their fries, they're amazing

Hands down the best burger EVER!!! We have been coming here for years and would suggest the 5 alarm burger with limitless fries and a mint milkshake :P If you're not in the mood for carbs, the grilled chicked salad hits the spot yo.

We had the free Tavern Cheeseburger for Veterans Day. The burger and fries were excellent.  And, the service was outstanding especially considering how busy they were. I mean the place was packed with lots of people waiting.  We got lucky and found a table in the bar right away. Our server was prompt and polite despite being extremely busy. Thank you Red Robin for your support!

Had a party of 5, 3 happen to be kids.  It took a while to get seated and it didn't go in ordered.  I only say that because they sat a table of 5 before us that had just walked in and 2 others till I asked if they still had us listed.  Got seated waitress was great although had to ask several times for things and they got the wrong hambugar.  Food was yummy as always though.  Love the one on 185th though lots better.

We dont do hamburgers much but a movie we wanted to see was in the area so we planned to do lunch here. Our party had burgers, salad, and a wrap.   All of us were satisfied.  The server was extremely personable, friendly, helpful, and attentive !!  Her name is Jodye. She is a trainer/mentor as well pertaining to serving. Good food and service !  I personally think the small Kiosk on the table is of minimal use. Customers can order appetizers, games, and pay bill thru it.  I have no reason to give them a favorable review except for the fact that they earned it.
Delish! I had the bonsai burger with sweet potato fries and mud pie. My hubby had a chicken dish. The service was awesome and they got everything out in a timely manner! Will Def be back.

I went in around 9pm Saturday night 2/13/16 at the Canyon Rd location Red Robin, maybe 1/10th full, ordered two gourmet burgers, mine was supposed to be medium and what I got was burnt! Hard as a rock and missing the tomato, so when I brought it to the waitress attention her mouth dropped. So she ordered me a new one, it took over 30 minutes to get a replacement, the manger brought it to the table, by this time my friends burger was cold because she waited for my second order to be rushed out like the waitress promised. The manager apologized for the first bad experience but didn't say anything about the second one taking over a half hour when they weren't busy. I told him we were leaving and he looked confused like why? He wanted to charge me for the meals we didn't even eat! When I told him I'm not going to pay for that, he asked if I wanted the burger complimentary in a to go box, so I brought it home and it was missing the grilled onions and tasted like salt! Like someone dumped a whole shaker on it, it went in the trash! I know Red Robin is a corporate chain and this Beaverton location could care less about losing one loyal customer because of awful service and manager who needs to watch Bar Rescue, but there's too many options within a 2 mile radius that you can get a better $14 burger.  So see ya #rrburger #redrobin #portlandburger

Good food, good service, packed house. I think my only notable commentary is less on the location itself and more on the changes at RR corporate. They are definitely changing their style lately. No longer is this a place for a group of friends to go and get a cheap and filling dinner (ie, the place of my high school years). Prices have gone way up-the "high end" burgers are $15! Fries are no longer complimentary- you have to eat your burger first before fry refills. Also, all of the promos are very "couple" oriented. Sigh. My childhood haunt is no longer what it once was.

I have only had great experiences at this Red Robin.  The servers are consistently friendly w/o being bothersome and the food is very good.  Note to management:  Your restaurant does a lot of business and it gets really noisy at times.  When you add in the generally loud overhead music it can be really unpleasant.  Would you consider keeping the music at a lower volume?

I would love to give this place a better rating,but, unfortunately, there were server problems regarding communication from the start. They came to our table promptly, and took our order. My girlfriend decided on a veggie bleu cheese burger with the broccoli side. She asked if there was a price differential between the blue cheese veggie burger and a regular burger, no answer. She ordered the veggie burger. She said the bun was soggy. When we got her bill for her veggie burger, it was fifteen dollars. She didn't get a refill of her veggies, nor was she asked if she cared for more veggies. When I got my burger, it was just ok, the meat was luke warm and the sandwich was soggy. It was basically a ten dollar big mac. I ordered the garlic and herb fries. When they brought more fries after asking for more, they brought me the regular fries. I can only gather, you are to eat what they bring you. Like Manna coming down from heaven. .I also didn't receive any more water until asking twice. I mean, for 3 people two soft drinks, it came to a little more than 40 dollars. Should we have to beg for good service. I will give them some leeway that it was Friday and rather crowded. However, I felt a little used when we left the proper tip to our waitress, according to their computer., Of course, when we finally mentioned that we felt passed over,, we got a patronizing attitude, like they were putting up with the problem children at table 8. she acted apologetic and seemed now more attentive to our needs, but the horses had already been let out of the barn.  Did we have to be celebrities to be checked on every so often while eating our gourmet hamburgers and bottomless fries for 15 plus dollars a pop? My dining companions were never asked if they wanted a drink refill either.  It was clear we were assembly lined such that I couldn't help but think tourist trap. But, we aren't tourists. So, we probably won't be back because it felt like they were more interested in our money than any customer care follow up. There are a lot of restaurants that can put together fries, sauce, and burgers, I didn't like their Extra charge for specialty sauces instead of mayo?  Does chipotle sauce really do them in putting it on their burgers instead of mayo? I felt like they were in our pocket from the time I sat down until the time we left. An update:   I have been patiently waiting pretty close to a week, your deadline when someone was supposed to contact me. I made it easy to contact me. I await a representative to get back with me so we can resolve what should be resolved. I am not  to be written off as a loss, I trust, I have always believed good will is good business and the customer is always right, I fully expect to be contacted now that they realize I was listening when they said we'd get back with you.
The blue ribbon burger is my favorite. Great quick service in the bar area. I haven't really sat anywhere different, but the staff is alway great.
Always good burgers and fries. Service was good and fast. I haven't been to one yet that has not been good. Love the bottomless fries.

Disappointed. $3 up charge for a wedge salad. Thrown at me on delivery with a comment about needing to sneeze. My beloved Whiskey River BBQ chicken was warm not hot. I had the server Steven take the wedge off my bill and gave it back unacceptable. How does a national chain not hire and train better than this?  Save your money and eat elsewhere in Beaverton! I wont be back!

Ordered a s beer and a burger! Finally a place that when I ask for a lot Of pink they actually give it to me! But sad that when I ask for extra fries and sauce it doesn't come out until I'm done eating.. Then I get charged for it... Really..   The only reason I still tipped well is because I've worked customer service for over 10 years. My server notified me that I would be charged extra for this, when I noticed it in my bill. You guys have had bottomless fries since I was a child and never charged for sauces!! Really wtf? :/  1 star for shadiness.
Great and fast service. Food tasted great. We will definitely be back. Ask for Becka to be your server.

We used to come here all the time but ever since the new menu and sharply increased prices, we visit much less. We had a waitress trainer and trainee. Between the two of them, they couldn't get it right. The drink order came out wrong, the proper drinks never did arrive. We were charged for incorrect drinks as well. I had the smoke BBQ burger and at $14.00, was seriously underwhelming. It was priced higher that most of the hotels I stay at for work but not nearly as good. Really sorry to see what has happened at Red Robin.

Good food and good service.   Seems like food quality and service is very consistent.   My kids love this place to,  very family and kid friendly.  Managers are always willing to please.   Thanks Red Robin!

Went for New Year's Eve dinner with my family - sadly, worst visit to RR ever!  Greeted by hostess when we entered but both managers standing there ignored us - did they even work there?  Seated promptly but drink orders were slow and had to ask three times for refills during meal - this used to be automatic!  Food quality was very poor, fries were not seasoned, some were dry and some were soooo greasy - again, this is a signature item.  My simple grilled cheese was inedible and burgers were overcooked.  Service was slow, and they were not short staffed in the front of the house.  We will not return to RR for a long time!!  So disappointed!
great place burgers were a little over cooked  so Jim the manager brought new ones personally. he is a class act , perfect!

Ridiculously over priced Shitty burger. Service equally shitty. Not only did it take over 20-30 minutes to even get our orders in but when we got our burgers we were beyond disappointed to have waited for those poor excuses of "gourmet" burgers. We have officially crossed of Red Robin as a restaurant chain that we would ever like to visit or even recommend. Disappointed.
Service was horrible. The only time someone came to check on our table is when we hit the button in the computer screen. Looking around, it seems other tables had that problem too.

Came to Red Robin and ordered some takeout meals, while waiting I ordered a drink at the bar, along with some chips and salsa.  The experience I had in the restaurant was good! Staff was attentive and friendly, and I was charged a reasonable amount for my drink (even though I used a premium spirit). The issue came in after we got our takeout order home. We ordered two mushroom Swiss burgers, and while I understand bottomless fries can't walk out the door with you the amount we got was pretty sad. Additionally, the mushrooms were not sautéed, more like raw but slightly warmed up. We also made a few requests (I.e. No jalapeños, sweet potato fries not regular, and extra dressing) all of which were forgotten. The food isn't bad or anything, it just seems like attention to detail could be stepped up, and takeout portions examined.

What a disappointment! Got it today $6.99 double "gourmet" burger. It's smaller than .99 cents McDonalds burger, test-less with huge peace of old lettuce and fries was not cooked all the way. The straw was shorter than my glass of soda. They charge me for playing trivia $1.99 while I was waiting for 25 minutes for my food. Overpriced, bad quality food, waist of money!

Red Robin has gotten so bad the portion they give you is ridiculous for the price and the customer service is not that great I have been to this location 4 times and I think the best thing I got was the cold beer  service sucked and food was cold

Definitely not impressed with this restaurant. I used to love coming here. My parents always ordered the chili, and it always came back ice cold. When they sent it back, it came back with the manager, where she proceeded to tell us that yes, it was warmed up in a microwave. We swore to never come back after that because we were highly dissatisfied, but we did end up coming back to give this restaurant one more chance. We got a waiter that had a very long ponytail (not discriminating). He was very rude. I do not want to get into detail. He was disrespectful and rude. We came back again, and this was the last time, which was about a week ago. My mom went into the bathroom and she didn't see, and slipped on water that overflowed from the overly plugged toilet in that stall. She slipped, luckily catching herself, because if she didn't, she would have had to be taken out in an ambulance. She came back to our table and told me and the rest of our family what had happened, and we called the manager over, thinking he was the manager of that restaurant, like he said he was (his name is Eric, he is the manager of the Hillsboro restaurant). He wrote down a report, but filled it out the complete opposite of what we told him (he wrote that I warned my mom that there was water on the floor when I came back to the bathroom, but what we said was that my mom and I briefly passed each other and said hi. he lied more on the report, but I won't go into more detail. I know this because of the lady we talked to that you will learn about in the next sentence). A couple days later, we called an insurance lady or whatever she does, and she proceeded to tell us that this was not an incident and there was nothing they could do. Basically, the burgers are not gourmet, and neither is this restaurant. I would not recommend doing business with this restaurant.

The Burgers ain't like they Used To Be at Red Robin. Still Good but, Overly Priced. $11.49 for a Burger that was $8.99 a couple of Years ago? REALLY!!!!!! Also their Fries have gotten Smaller too. I remember when they got Streak Fries that were Long & Crispy. The Onion Rings were the Bomb. At least they got that right. The Clam Chowder wasn't bad either.  The Servers are the only reason I'm giving more than 2 Stars. They were very Nice & Let my Hubby & Me stay till P.G.E got our Power back.  Note to the Owner: We aren't coming back for awhile. We can get the same Burgers from Burger King.

It is what it is. Most people going in know that it's a nationally run burger joint. Food is good, service is usually top-notch at most locations, but this one is a different story, more on that in a bit. My kids love coming to Red Robin too, so that's a plus.  Only complaints are these:  While I understand they're trying to attract more adults into their establishments, they shouldn't forget what made them so popular, families with kids. They are changing the restaurants to more adult style themes, and moving away from more family-centered decor.  The other is simply the prices. Which can be a little outrageous for some of their "higher end" burgers. Cmon, $15 for a burger and fries, I can still get a steak dinner elsewhere for that price.  ***Now as for this location in particular, the service here is somewhat slow, and the last 2 times we've come the servers seem to be stretched so thin, that they forget things. Like our food. In fact, the last outing, not only did we have to waive down our server just to put the order through, but the table next to us, he completely forgot one of the customers meals all together. Was surprised when the manager came over to them, and didn't even offer to comp their meal, he just apologized. Not good, not good at all.  Other than those complaints, you know the deal. It's a national burger restaurant.

Sad to see all the really moronic reviews on here. People do not understand what reviews are for. This is NOT the complaint department people. We don't care you came in on a Saturday and had to wait to be seated. That's called common sense. Tell us how the food was, is it worth going? All I see are some really silly reviews and whiny complainers. Yelp should do some cleaning up of these reviews. Still the best burger in town and the best service! I go at least once a week with my son. We've made it a tradition since he could walk and talk. Whiskey River BBQ burger is my fav!

I've been to this location several times and never had an experience like this.  We were seated very fast and it wasn't very busy so what's the excuse as to why our server finally decided to come over to our table after 20 mins? She didn't say anything like "oh hey thanks for waiting" or "sorry about that". I ordered a poppin' purple lemonade and it was missing the lemonade so I was literally drinking overly sweet-flavored water. No opportunity to ask for it to be remade as we didn't see our server again that night. The food came out very fast and I was very disappointed in the cold fries and my burnt burger. I've never ever had a complaint once about the food, I love Red Robin as much as the next person. Oh! Our server did actually walk by, but it was more of a "hey you got that alright" thrown carelessly over her shoulder when I was leaving a review on their order station thingy on the tables. It's just frustrating when you expect the same service you've received once before, and get treated like you're completely invisible to the person that's supposed to be kind to you. I honestly don't think I'll be going this Red Robin again.

This location has gone down hill a little bit. The last couple of times the service has been only so-so (only checked on us once for soda & fry refills) & the food just average. I do like some of the new additions to the menu though.

In three different occasions within less than two months at this SPECIFIC location. I've had the worst experiences with the Host/Hostess. I truly don't understand how difficult it is. To smile, seat people and while doing so- make some sort of small talk "hi, how's your day going?"  Yet, the first time My friend & I came around noon. Literally stood in the front waiting for anyone to seat us. I counted at least a full of employees see us but yet walk in different directions. It took about 10-15 minutes until someone sat us. (I'm not even exaggerating)  2nd time - there were 3-4 hosts in the front. While, myself and two other friends of mine walked in. All they did was chat until someone finally noticed we were there.  3rd (yesterday) Her name is Jess (bluish-purple short hair) she was beyond the rudest. She first walked up. No smile, barely any eye contact and finally said "Hi" after ruffling around things for a moment and She asked if we were over 21+, we said yes, she said okay. You guys can go sit in the bar and walked away. We went up to the bar area and all tables were full. So we came back and waiting on her. When she came back, she starred at us but didn't say anything! So, I said- we'd like to sit at a booth. She grabbed two menus and looked at an iPad and looked around then walked off without a word. Now realizing we were supposed to follow her, she flopped the menus down and walked away.  At this point.. my friend and I were irritated. Before leaving we did speak to an manager. Even though, he didn't give us his name but that's fine. This specific location has gone down. It wasn't even packed any of time times I've visited. All the waiters we had were always AMAZING! Which, is why I'm not quite understanding why it's the Hosts that seem to be so difficult when they have the least work.  I've worked in fast food, retail etc. in my past so I'm not naive to the industry. But the service I received in 3 different occasions is ridiculous!! It's disheartening because the host/hostess are the first interaction you have with the establishment. So, to experience this even once. Definitely, loses you business!

Had been at a Red Robin location in Las Vegas many years ago, not impressed, so we tried it once again this time in Beaverton, OR due to the many people always there. Must be good, right? Not. Seated quickly, server friendly but we are about the food and we did not enjoy any of it. Ordered one of the specialty burgers and one of the Whiskey River ones and both were tasteless, couldn't taste the beef or the fixings. Buns were unnaturally soft and bland and the fries were quite terrible, frozen and baked, mushy and bad. Expensive for what this was. Considering there are good burgers in town we will not be back. And don't tell me I don't know what I'm talking about, we are a family of Chefs in the Food Service Business (don't have small children) and we know good / value when we have it, this is not it. If you want good burgers better go to Killer Burger or Broadway Saloon or even BJ's, hey I'll even go happily to Carl Jr's. So now we know.... Plus I hear this chain is for families with children, really? This would be expensive for this demographic, Killer Burger is more accessible. Anyway, my 2 cents....

If the general manager had been in during our visit tonight, these employees would have been fired on the spot. Behavior was absolutely unacceptable. Right down to the point that we had to specifically call them out on being disrespectful and rude! Chewing on your hands while yelling toward your coworkers is disgusting and uncalled for.  Food was fine, but the service was literally geared towards pushing customers out the door! Definitely think twice before coming here.

I was spending time with my son's place Friday nite, 11/17, and we ordered dinner for 3 of us online from Red Robin. After having waited over an hour, they brought 2 dinners, one was not right, incomplete and completely missing dinner number 3! We were given $15 back on a $50 order, told they'd bring #3 ASAP. An hour later they drop off the dinner with missing food again! My order, had soup not salad, bottom bun of burger was soaked! Goodbye Red Robin!

Holy Slow Batman! Super slow service as usual. Place is empty and still takes forever to get a hamburger. Service is alright and to be expected. Seriously though, my Kids's ordered a Mac and cheese that I know they just throw in the microwave.

So I'm going to start off by saying this was my last meal before I do the whole 30 and I was really looking forward to a delicious burger. Well, I'm disappointed.  I have a gift card, placed the order online and asked my boyfriend to pick it up on his way home (I don't have a car otherwise I would have done it). I called to ask if I can pay over the phone, the lady says no. I ask her if I give my boyfriend the gift card number if they can run it that way she said yes.  Surprise surprise! They wouldn't let him use the gift card number to pay for the order. He ended up having to buy it off his card.  The food was cold, soggy and the burger was sill practically mooing even when I asked for it to be well done. We asked for 3 containers of sauce and receive NONE. My side dish of Mac and cheese was about 2 child sized bites, and I asked for no onions and guess what? GOT ONIONS.  This is the worst Red Robin experience I've had. Misinformation AND cold crappy food.
Had the veggie burger and came down with severe food poisoning. Will never visit again .

You're better off saving some money and going to Burgerville across the street.   Everything was bland and sloppy.  Meat tasted old, fries didnt taste fresh but like they had been sitting under a warmer.  Just pretty shitty all around.    I have about 12 years experience combined of bartending, serving  and cooking.  The only thing worth it's price was probably the draft beer.   Couldn't even get a water until it was time for the server to get money.
This location in Beaverton is excellent friendly fast and very good at refills  Do not I repeat do not go the Red Robin in tanasbourne under staffed dirty and rude general manager
